group_1.textLeft: Yo, where are the lanterns put?

group_1.textRight: Ain't they in the warehouse? Go take a look.

group_1.textLeft: I'm asking you 'cause it ain't there!

group_1.textRight: ...Are you guys arguing again?

group_1.textLeft: San!

group_1.textRight: I've taken the lanterns out of storage,
separated them into those in need of repair and@those that aren't, and put them in a separate room.

group_1.textLeft: What, you already did that?
Man, you're so thoughtful, San.@I'd love to have you as my wife.

group_1.textRight: Saying that sort of thing is considered sexual@harassment in this day and age!

group_1.textLeft: Ooh, scary scary.
Even though I've known you since you were@a lil' crybaby.

group_1.textRight: Cut it out. I'm a grown woman now!
You can't keep treating me like I'm still a child.

group_1.textLeft: That's 'cause you're like a lil' sis to us, San.

group_1.textRight: The only place where I'm treated like a younger@sister is in this Youth Association, though.
That's right, that's right!
Outside of the Youth Association,
Lady San is known for being cool and collected,@you know!

group_1.textLeft: Huh, are you sure that's the San we know?

group_1.textRight: C'mon... Enough of this nonsense, let's all get back@to work!
The Fire Festival is approaching!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, yeah.
You've become quite a gutsy girl, San, haven'cha?

group_1.textRight: That's all thanks to how sloppy you all are,@Big Bro Tatsu.

group_1.textLeft: Ha ha ha!@Maybe you're right.
Ah, Mr. Chairman!
Thanks for your hard work.
...What happened?@You seem really tired...

group_1.textRight: Well, so...
There's been rumors about the Hikarizuka Youth@Association being involved in shady business...

group_1.textLeft: What...?!

group_1.textRight: I took it as nothing serious 'cause I was sure@no one'd believe that...
But then one of our major sponsors began saying@they're no longer sponsoring the Festival...
I tried to tell him it was just an utterly groundless@rumor, but he wouldn't listen to me...

group_1.textLeft: But we did nothing wrong...!
Could it be, could it be!
That my dad's company also dropped@its sponsorship...?

group_1.textRight: Oh, it's fine on Mr. Yukari's side.
I tried to explain it to him on the phone,@but he seems to understand.

group_1.textLeft: Th-thank goodness...!

group_1.textRight: But we won't have enough money now that@we've lost our major sponsorship...
I doubt we'll even be able to hold the Festival@this year, let alone next year...
...Well, I still have some contacts. I'll see if I can get@some new sponsorships.

group_1.textLeft: Please, Mr. Chairman...
C'mon, loosen up a bit. It's gonna be alright.
Last time there was an uproar about abolishing@the Festival, we got to keep it going.

group_1.textRight: Is that so...?

group_1.textLeft: [chara:103101:effect_emotion_angry_0][se:7219_strain]Aren't you being a little too optimistic?
No need to get your knickers in a twist.
We aren't gonna let a traditional Fire Festival@go under just 'cause of financial difficulties.
Leave it to your big bros!

group_1.textRight: Then, what are you going to do?

group_1.textLeft: Welp, we'll see 'bout that.

group_1.textRight: Please, you've got to think harder...!
(Even if the miracle of that time won't happen@anymore...!)
Well, calm yourself.
Sorry for worrying you...@but I'll take care of the funds.
So, I want everyone to continue preparing@for the Festival.

group_1.textLeft: As our Chairman said, back to preparations we go!

group_1.textRight: Um... Lady San, sorry...@I didn't think that through...

group_1.textLeft: ...Hey, Miyu. Come with me for a moment.
There's something I need to tell you about.
